required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Emervel Classic Lidocaine Versus Juvederm® Ultra in Treatment of Moderate to Severe Facial Wrinkles and Folds
clinical_study.official_title: A Pivotal USA Randomized, Evaluator-blinded, Active-controlled, Multi-center, Split-face Comparison Study of Emervel Classic Lidocaine Versus Juvederm® Ultra in the Treatment of Moderate to Severe Facial Wrinkle Folds

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the effectiveness and safety of Emervel Classic Lidocaine versus Juvederm® Ultra in the treatment of moderate to severe facial wrinkles and folds.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change in wrinkle severity score from baseline to 24 weeks after final initial injection
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 24 weeks after final initial injection
primary_outcome.description: The wrinkle severity is measured by using a wrinkle severity rating scale with 1 being absent and 5 being extreme.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in wrinkle severity score from baseline to 12 weeks after final initial injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 12 weeks after final initial injection
secondary_outcome.description: The wrinkle severity is measured by using a wrinkle severity rating scale with 1 being absent and 5 being extreme.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in wrinkle severity score from baseline to 3 weeks after final initial injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 3 weeks after final initial injection
secondary_outcome.description: The wrinkle severity is measured by using a wrinkle severity rating scale with 1 being absent and 5 being extreme.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in wrinkle severity score from baseline to 36 weeks after final initial injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 36 weeks after final initial injection
secondary_outcome.description: The wrinkle severity is measured by using a wrinkle severity rating scale with 1 being absent and 5 being extreme.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in wrinkle severity score from baseline to 48 weeks after final initial injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 48 weeks after final initial injection
secondary_outcome.description: The wrinkle severity is measured by using a wrinkle severity rating scale with 1 being absent and 5 being extreme.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in subject self assessment of wrinkle severity from baseline to 24 weeks after final initial injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 24 weeks after final initial injection
secondary_outcome.description: The wrinkle severity is measured by using a wrinkle severity rating scale with 1 being absent and 5 being extreme.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of pain assessment after initial injection (Baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Subject's pain as evaluated by the Numeric pain intensity scale. 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst possible pain. Pain is asssesed at Time 0 (the most severe pain during the initial injection), 15, 30, 45, 60 minutes and 24 hours after each injection session.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of pain assessment after initial touch-up injection (3 weeks after initial injection)
secondary_outcome.description: Subject's pain as evaluated by the Numeric pain intensity scale. 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst possible pain. Pain is asssesed at Time 0 (the most severe pain during the initial touch-up injection), 15, 30, 45, 60 minutes and 24 hours after each injection session.

arm_group.description: Emervel Classic Lidocaine injected into left nasolabial fold. Juvederm® Ultra injected into right nasolabial fold.
Juvederm® Ultra injected into left nasolabial fold. Emervel Classic Lidocaine injected into right nasolabial fold.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The subject is a male or female 18 years of age or older
- The subject has bilateral nasolabial folds that, in the opinion of both the Blinded Evaluating Investigator and the Unblinded Injecting Investigator, can be corrected with an injectable dermal implant
- The subject has the same Wrinkle Severity Rating Scale (WSRS) score of 3 or 4 (moderate or severe) for each nasolabial fold
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subject has active skin disease or inflammation on or near a nasolabial fold that, in the Principal Investigator's opinion, would interfere with the study device injections and/or study assessments.
- The subject has a history of sensitivity to hyaluronic acid
- The subject has a history of sensitivity to lidocaine or other amide type anesthetics
- The subject is, in the Principal Investigator's opinion, at undue risk based on the precautions, warnings and contraindications for local lidocaine anesthetics.
